definition: to have no strength/to feel weak/exhausted/feeling listless/boring/of no interest
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
stalwart/sturdy/strong/powerful
strength/energy/enthusiasm/spirit/mood/expression/interest/CL:把[ba3]/Taiwan pr. [jing4]
erhua variant of 沒勁|没劲[mei2 jin4]

sentences.english: Some 28 percent of adolescents say they are too tired to exercise, due to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 28%的年轻人表示，由于睡眠不足而没劲儿运动。

sentences.english: Smart personal finance is boring, too.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的个人理财书都很没劲。

sentences.english: The film is so boring that I walked out mid-way through it.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影真没劲，我看了一半就出来了。

sentences.english: If I wasn’t enjoying a piece, I stopped reading it.
sentences.chinese: 如果我读一段没劲，就会停下来。

sentences.english: The conclusion of the movie was anticlimactic.
“Like a slug,” Marina says flatly. “It’s disgusting.”
sentences.chinese: “像个鼻涕虫，”玛丽娜没劲地说，“很恶心。”

sentences.english: Well Culture is important but by comparision of military history its boring.
sentences.chinese: 是的，文化是很重要，但是和军事史一比就太没劲了。

sentences.english: That would be great. The party won't be fun without WangLe.
sentences.chinese: 太好了，没有王乐聚会就没劲了。

sentences.english: Doing this just makes you boring and predictable.
sentences.chinese: 没有主见只会让人感觉你这人既没劲又没什么深度。

sentences.english: A:I find my job extremely boring these days.
sentences.chinese: 最近我觉得工作非常没劲。

sentences.english: A woman goes to her doctor complaining that she is exhausted all the time.
sentences.chinese: 一个女人去看医生，说她一直浑身没劲儿。

sentences.english: The party won't be fun without you .

definition: boring/of no interest
erhua variant of 沒勁|没劲[mei2 jin4]
energetic/exciting/of interest
dull/vapid/colorless
(dialect) to be full of zeal/high-spirited/exhilarating/to stir sb up
awkward/unhandy/be indisposed/not feel well
bored/boring/senseless
to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
erhua variant of 好玩[hao3 wan2]
tired of/fed up/sick/(of a person) to annoy/tiresome
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
euphemistic equivalent of 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
variant of 扯淡[che3 dan4]
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
to anger/to annoy
